Reason: The configuration option 'enableAntiAliasing' is performance-sensitive. The code snippet shows that when 'args.enableAntiAliasing' is true, the image is filtered using an anti-aliasing filter 'OP_ANTIALIAS'. Anti-aliasing operations are known to be time-expensive and can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, especially when applied to images. Therefore, enabling anti-aliasing can directly and substantially affect system performance, making this configuration performance-sensitive.
